result.execSummary:
The defendant Devonta L Griffin was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (17 pages) commencing MARCH 22, 2016 received and filed. kl

Defendant Devonta L Griffin in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Defendant Devonta L Griffin in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements to the court by counsel and defendant.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 70  MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 429 days time served, concurrent with any other sentence serving.  CONFINEMENT of 30 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 40 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
-Obtain GED.
-Seek and maintain employment.
-Participate in counseling needs as determined.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  
Defendant remanded.
Filed, Pretrial credit
Filed, Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
filed by the state:  Witness List; Jury Instructions; Motion in Limine

Defendant Devonta L Griffin in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Defendant Devonta L Griffin in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  To the charged offense:    Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant  examined as to plea, and entered a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Defendant is remanded pending sentencing on 3-22-2016.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for March 22, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court, defendant Devonta L Griffin not in court, in custody. Appearance is waived.   Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel believes that there may be a resolution to this matter and requests a date next week.  Court orders that the defendant is to remain in Milwaukee County Jail until the next court date.  Plea hearing scheduled for March 17, 2016 at 08:15 am.

Atty Partickus contacts the court; conflict with today's date and requests FPT be put over to tomorrow morning at 8:15.
Defendant is in custody.
Clerk advised ADA Sara Schroeder will be handling this matter for the State. Deputy Court Clerk ccp.

Attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus in court, defendant Devonta L Griffin not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy court clerk ccp.
Case set for scheduling conference. This matter has been transferred from Branch 35. Discussion regarding the history of this case. Court ordered final pretrial and jury trial dates be set. Case adjourned to Branch 25.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 9, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Effective October 31, 2015, Per Chief Judge directive 15-19, this case is assigned to the Honorable Stephanie Rothstein, Br 25.

Defendant Devonta L Griffin in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Defendant Devonta L Griffin in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant has case #14CF1353 scheduled sentencing hearing on revocation today, this matter set for status conference. Defense counsel represented defendant in revocation matter and disputes report submitted by probation agent and allegations in this case.  This matter is in trial posture.  Defense wishes to be heard on bail, Court hears argument. For reasons as set forth on the record, Court DENIES defense motion to modify bail.  Parties are advised that effective October 31, 2015, Per Chief Judge directive 15-19, this case is assigned to the Honorable Stephanie Rothstein, Br 25.  Scheduling conference scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Devonta L Griffin in court with attorney Wendy Ann Patrickus.  Defendant Devonta L Griffin in custody.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Devonta L Griffin in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Devonta L Griffin in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  HMP
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
